title: Update README.md
body: Fix a typo in anchor link (double "#").

title: Comet-ml experiment management SDK integration
body:
Hey! I'm software engineer from [Comet](https://www.comet.com). We would like to introduce integration of Comet experiment management SDK into mistral-finetune library.

This PR implements integration with Comet experiment management SDK (https://www.comet.com).

What was done:

- Implemented new argument type to support Comet experiment options
- Implemented integration of logging metrics to the Comet experiment

title: Enhancement: Improve type handling, error messages and validation
body:
-  Update RMSNorm to use native PyTorch type conversion
- Enhance JSONL files error message for better clarity
- Add comprehensive validation for LoRA arguments

title: Crash fix due to inconsistent use of tabs and spaces
body: This fix is with respect to #95

title: qlora finetuning script added
body:
In this PR, I tried to add a complete guide on mistral-7b finetuning along with covering the potential questions one could have about Lora implementation. Hope this helps the community! 
Cheers

title: Fix a mis-aligned else that causes a crash
body:
Fixes an issue introduced in the commit `984ca2dc` where the `else` is misaligned causing the following crash when running data validation tool.

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<frozen runpy>", line 189, in _run_module_as_main
  File "<frozen runpy>", line 159, in _get_module_details
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap_external>", line 1074, in get_code
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap_external>", line 1004, in source_to_code
  File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 241, in _call_with_frames_removed
  File "/home/ec2-user/workspace/mistral/mistral-finetune/utils/validate_data.py", line 113
    else:
TabError: inconsistent use of tabs and spaces in indentation
```

title: Updated WPS and params_config for large and nemo
body:
Updated WPS dictionary to account for mistral-large-latest and open-mistral-nemo. 

Updated the params_config values for hidden dimension for large 2 and nemo as well.

title: Validation script fix: conversation error
feature/improve-type-annotations-and-error-handling
body:
## Description
This pull request enhances the training script with improved type annotations and more robust error handling. The changes focus on making the code more maintainable, easier to debug, and less prone to runtime errors.

## Changes
- Added more consistent type annotations throughout the code
- Implemented more robust error handling and logging, particularly for file operations and network-related tasks
- Refactored the large `_train` function into smaller, more focused functions
- Added additional error checking with specific exceptions and informative error messages
- Enhanced logging throughout the code for better debugging and monitoring

## Testing
- [ ] Manually tested the script with various configurations
- [ ] Verified that error messages are clear and helpful
- [ ] Checked that type annotations are consistent and correct

## Additional Notes
- This PR does not change the core functionality of the training process
- The changes are aimed at improving code quality and developer experience

title: Fix/parse-available-tools
body:
**Issue**

https://github.com/mistralai/mistral-finetune/issues/77

**Goal**

The goal of this PR is to fix the available_tools parsing loop. Currently, only the last tool is being added to the available_tools list.

**Expected Behavior**

All tools should be added to the available tools list.

**Contributor**

@joaoppn

title: typo in comment: "mult-turn" to "multi-turn"
body: Corrected a typo in the comment within the maybe_chunk_lines function. The term "mult-turn" was changed to "multi-turn" for better clarity and accuracy.

title: typo: correct "MoEs models" to "MoE models"
body: Corrected the term "MoEs models" to "MoE models" in the documentation for consistency and grammatical accuracy. The acronym "MoE" stands for "Mixture of Experts" and should be used in its singular form followed by "models" to maintain proper grammatical structure.

title: fix a typo in the tutorials
body: "formated" -> "formatted"

title: fix: correct spelling in comments
body: Fixed a typo in the comments where "mult-turn" was corrected to "multi-turn".

title: fix: typos in docstring and logging message
body:
- Corrected "it's" to "its" in the docstring of get_fsdp_policy function.

- Changed "parameter" to "parameters" in the log_train_params function.

title: fix: Correct grammar in README.md
body: - Updated the phrase "1-2% additional weights" to "1-2% of additional weights" to correctly include the preposition "of," following proper grammatical structure.

title: fix: typo in reformat_jsonl function output message
body: Corrected the misspelling of "formatted" in the print statement within the reformat_jsonl function.

title: fix: typo in get_fsdp_policy docstring
body: Corrected typo in docstring of the get_fsdp_policy function - "it's" to "its" for proper possessive usage.

title: fix: typo in TrainArgs warning message
body: Corrected a typo in the warning message of the TrainArgs class. The word "erros" has been changed to "errors" to improve readability and accuracy.

title: fix: typo in function parameters error message
body: Corrected "empyt" to "empty" in FunctionFormatError message for function parameters check.

title: Fix: typo in exception messages: "formated" to "formatted"
body: Corrected a typo in the exception messages where "formated" was changed to "formatted". This change affects the custom exception classes `MessageFormatError`, `ToolCallFormatError`, `FunctionFormatError`, and `ConversationFormatError`.

title: fix: typo in comment: "shorder" to "shorter"
body: Corrected a typo in the comment within the maybe_chunk_lines function where "shorder" was changed to "shorter" to improve code readability and maintainability.

title: fix: typos in InstructArgs comments
body:
Corrected "Assisant" to "Assistant" in multiple places.

Corrected "loose" to "lose" in the comment explaining dynamic chunking.

title: Adds Issue/Bug template.
body: Adding a template for issues and bugs, I've disabled blank issues for now.

title: fix: typos in multiple functions
body:
Corrected typos in the following functions:

1. Fixed  two instances of "seperate" to "separate" in the get_fsdp_policy function.
2. Fixed "randomely" to "randomly" in the initialize_lora_parameters function error message.
3. Fixed "intialized" to "initialized" in the load_model function assertion message.

title: fix: grammar and typo in logging message
body: Corrected "You are have disabled..." to "You have disabled..." as well as "OOM erros" to "OOM errors"

title: fix: typo "erros" to "errors" in logging message
body: Changed "OOM erros" to "OOM errors" in the warning message to fix a typographical error.

title: fix: grammar "You are have" to "You have" in logging message
body: Changed "You are have disabled...". to "You have disabled..." to correct a grammatical error.

title: fix: correct article usage for GPU recommendation
body: Corrected the article usage in the README file for GPU recommendation from "a A100 or H100 GPU" to "an A100 or H100 GPU". The article "an" is used before words that start with a vowel sound or a silent 'h'. Since "A100" starts with a vowel sound, "an" is the correct article to use. Although "H100" starts with a consonant sound, "an" is often used for consistency in lists where one item starts with a vowel sound.

title: fix: typo in mixed precision test comments
body: This commit corrects a typo in the comments of the mixed precision test code. The term "downcasted" has been replaced with the grammatically correct "downcast". This change ensures the comments are accurate and maintain a professional standard.

title: fix: correct subject-verb agreement in formatting instructions
body: Corrected the subject-verb agreement error in the sentence "reformat the data into the correct format and skip the cases that *doesn't* have the right format" to "reformat the data into the correct format and skip the cases that *don't* have the right format".

title: fix: correct spelling of "length" in comments
body: Corrected the misspelling "lentgh" to "length" in the comments within the notebook.

title: fix: remove repeated word in notebook metadata
body: Corrected a repeated word "can" in the phrase "you can can run this notebook" within the notebook metadata section. This change improves readability and accuracy in the notebook instructions.

title: fix: typo in error message for JSONL line count verification
body: This commit fixes a typo in the verify_size function where the error message for exceeding the maximum number of JSONL lines incorrectly used the singular form "conversation" instead of "conversations" which reflects the correct plural form when referring to multiple lines.

title: fix: verb tense in print statement
body: Changed "Skip {idx}th sample" to "Skipped {idx}th sample" for verb tense consistency, clarity, and alignment with standard logging practices.

title: Fixing a typo in README.md
body:
Hi,

"architecture" needs to be plural -> "architectures"

Didier

body: Corrected the typo in the comment regarding the maximum bytes for JSONL files. Changed "rougly" to "roughly" for better clarity and accuracy.

body: Corrected the misspelling "instuction" to "instruction" in the comment.

title: fix: typo in JSON validation script
body: This commit corrects the typo 'formated' to 'formatted' in the JSON validation script and ensures consistency across related files.

title: Fix typo: "formated" -> "formatted"
body: Corrected three instances of the misspelled word "formated" to "formatted" in error messages within the script.

title: fix: correct typo + capitalization in title
body: Changed "Getting starting fine-tuning Mistral 7B" to "Getting Started with Fine-Tuning Mistral 7B". Corrected "starting" to "started" to fix the verb form, added "with" for grammatical correctness, and capitalized the title for proper title case formatting.

title: Fix typo: Correct "has" to "have" in validation section
body: Changed "The reformatted datasets still has some errors" to "The reformatted datasets still have some errors" for proper subject-verb agreement.

title: Fix typo in comment: "seting" to "setting"
body: Corrected the spelling of "setting" in the comment to ensure clarity and correct usage.

title: fix: Correct typos and formatting
body:
- Corrected four misspelled instances of the word "formated" to "formatted" in the documentation.
- Added a space after each period to ensure writing standards and readability.

title: Fixed typo in TrainArgs class comment
body: Corrected the comment for num_microbatches in TrainArgs class to remove redundancy. Changed "calling doing an optimizer step" to "doing an optimizer step" for better clarity.

title: Rename system_prompt to system in docu
body:
Rename in `README.md` the role name `system_prompt` into `system`, to document the roles defined in class `Roles` in
`mistral_common/protocol/instruct/messages.py` and avoid the error `finetune.data.exceptions.UnrecognizedRoleError` when calling `python -m utils.validate_data`.

title: Add explicit Weights and Biases support
body: changes in readme.md and default examples/7b.yml file for more explicit wandb variable use

title: Fix py39
body: Make py39 compatible: https://github.com/mistralai/mistral-finetune/issues/9

title: Update README.md
body:
Fix typo and improve clarity in data source description

- Changed "jsonl file of a path" to "jsonl file or a path" to correct the conjunction usage.

- Added "a" before "jsonl file" for consistency and proper article usage.

Justification:

1. Corrected the conjunction usage to "or" to properly indicate an alternative between two options.

2. Ensured proper article usage by adding "a" before "jsonl file" to maintain grammatical consistency and clarity.

title: Update README.md
body:
The specific correction is from "an helpful assistant" to "a helpful assistant." This modification is necessary for the following reason:

   - The use of "an" before a word beginning with a consonant sound (in this case, "helpful") is grammatically incorrect in English. The correct indefinite article for such words is "a."

title: Fix typos and grammatical errors in the documentation
body:
**Description of Change:**

| **Original Text**                                  | **Corrected Text**                           | **Reason for Change**                         |
|----------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------|
| a A100 or H100 GPU                                 | an A100 or H100 GPU                          | Correct grammatical error (use of "an" before a vowel sound) |
| such as the 7B a single GPU                        | such as the 7B, a single GPU                 | Correct punctuation error (add comma for clarity)            |
| correpsodns                                        | corresponds                                  | Correct typographical error (spelling mistake)              |
| In function calling the `"id"` of                  | In function calling, the `"id"` of           | Correct punctuation error (add comma for clarity)            |
